title: This Battery Bank is FAST!
tags: Fastest phone charger in the world
description: Drop a like if you're down to win a phone :) Enter here:  The Best Tech Under $50!  How Fast is a Quick Charge 3.0 External Battery Bank?   My favorite Dream Desk yet   Add me on Snapchat!  New Food Project:  My Gear:  Instagram:  Twitter:
transcript: - [Voiceover] Hey guys, Jonathan here and QuickCharge 3.0 is fast but if you've ever wondered exactly how fast let's find out. For starters, to even take advantage of this feature you'll need a device that supports QuickCharge 3.0 and as of now the only major flagship phones that do are the LG G5 and HTC 10. On the technical side QuickCharge 3.0 works by talking with your device to figure out exactly how much power is needed to minimize charge times while still maintaining efficiency. As far as testing goes, huge shout out to Anker for sending out a handful of their QuickCharge 3.0 products and not only sponsoring the video, but also a really killer giveaway. So go ahead and drop like if you are down to win some stuff. So with the G5 I started out with a battery level of 19%. After 35 minutes of charging that jumped up to 85%. Now this was done with Anker's PowerCore 10000, which on the outside may look small but proves that size matters not. Inside is a massive 10000 mA hour battery which make it not only the smallest but also the lightest portable battery in its range. The fact that it's actually smaller than a phone but holds the capacity to charge one three times is awesome and makes a perfect addition to your tech bag. If you need more power though, there is also the PowerCore 20000 which doubles the battery capacity and is perfect for you Tech Under $50 fans. It's definitely not as compact as the 10000 but it's still really light, weighing in at 12.5 ounces. What's sick though is with both of these, they are backwards compatible with older versions of QuickCharge. So that means if you have something like the Galaxy S7 which supports QuickCharge 2.0 it's still going to work great and get you juiced up super quick like. (light music) Now, no doubt portable power is cool. But if you're looking for some QuickCharge 3.0 action at your desk or potentially something more permanent this is Anker's PowerPort 6. You get a single QuickCharge 3.0 port and then five additional ports that give you the fastest possible charge across all ports simultaneously. This also has a trick up its sleeve called PowerIQ which replicates the charging pattern that was intended for your device so that way it will charge as fast as possible without risking any damage. So if you're in a household that's constantly battling over who can charge their device this just might save your family. As far as testing this goes, with the HTC 10 and 30 minutes of charging I saw it jump from 34% up to 78%. And keep in mind, this is with the screen on the entire time which makes it all the more impressive. (light music) As far as that giveaway goes, I've teamed up with Anker to give you guys a chance to win your smart phone of choice. Whether it's a G5, the HTC 10, the Galaxy S7, or even an iPhone 6s, or 6s Plus. The choice is yours. On top of that there is also a 100 codes so you can grab Anker's PowerCore 10000 for a penny. Details on that, links to everything featured in this video, and more importantly how you can win that smart phone are down below. This is Jonathan and I will catch you guys later. (light music)
